title: What is Go?
detail: I want to learn Go programming.
author: Alice

answers.content: Go is an open-source programming language created at Google.
Go, also known as Golang, is designed for simplicity and efficiency.

title: How does concurrency work in Go?
detail: I'm curious about the concurrency model in Go.
author: Dave

answers.content: Concurrency in Go is achieved through goroutines and channels.

title: What are the best practices for error handling in Go?
detail: I'm looking for guidelines on error handling.
author: Frank

answers.content: Prefer explicit error handling over using multiple return values.
Always check if an error is `nil` before proceeding.

title: What is the purpose of Go?
detail: I'm looking to understand the main goals and applications of the Go programming language.
author: John Doe

answers.content: Go is designed for simplicity and efficiency. It is often used for web servers, cloud services, and other networked applications.
Go supports concurrency, making it a great choice for parallel processing applications.
